verses.verse: Do we begin <WG756> again <WG3825> to commend <WG4921> ourselves? <WG1438> or <WG2228> <WG3361> need <WG5535> we, as some <WG5100> others, letters <WG1992> of commendation <WG4956> to you, or <WG2228> letters of commendation <WG4956> from you?
You are our letter <WG1992> written <WG1449> in our hearts, <WG2588> known <WG1097> and read <WG314> of all <WG3956> men: <WG444>

For as much as you are manifestly <WG5319> declared <WG5319> to be the letter <WG1992> of Christ <WG5547> ministered <WG1247> by us, written <WG1449> not with ink, <WG3188> but with the Spirit <WG4151> of the living <WG2198> God; <WG2316> not in tables <WG4109> of stone, <WG3035> but in fleshy <WG4560> tables <WG4109> of the heart. <WG2588>
And such <WG5108> trust <WG4006> have <WG2192> we through <WG1223> Christ <WG5547> to God-ward: <WG4314>
Not that we are sufficient <WG2425> of ourselves <WG1438> to think <WG3049> any <WG5100> thing as of ourselves; <WG1438> but our sufficiency <WG2426> is of God; <WG2316>

Who <WG3739> also <WG2532> has made <WG2427> us able <WG2427> ministers <WG1249> of the new <WG2537> testament; <WG1242> not of the letter, <WG1121> but of the spirit: <WG4151> for the letter <WG1121> kills, <WG615> but the spirit <WG4151> gives life. <WG2227>

But if <WG1487> the ministration <WG1248> of death, <WG2288> written <WG1722> <WG1121> and engraved <WG1795> in stones, <WG3037> was glorious, <WG1722> <WG1391> so <WG5620> that the children <WG5207> of Israel <WG2474> could <WG1410> not steadfastly <WG816> behold <WG816> the face <WG4383> of Moses <WG3475> for the glory <WG1391> of his countenance; <WG4383> which <WG3588> glory <WG1391> was to be done <WG2673> away: <WG2673>
How <WG4459> shall not the ministration <WG1248> of the spirit <WG4151> be rather <WG3123> glorious? <WG1722>

For if <WG1487> the ministration <WG1248> of condemnation <WG2633> be glory, <WG1391> much <WG4183> more <WG3123> does the ministration <WG1248> of righteousness <WG1343> exceed <WG4052> in glory. <WG1391>
For even <WG2532> that which was made <WG1392> glorious <WG1392> had no <WG3761> glory <WG1392> in this <WG5129> respect, <WG3313> by reason <WG1752> of the glory <WG1391> that excels. <WG5235>
For if <WG1487> that which is done <WG2673> away <WG2673> was glorious, <WG1223> <WG1391> much <WG4183> more <WG3123> that which remains <WG3306> is glorious. <WG1722> <WG1391>
Seeing then <WG3767> that we have <WG2192> such <WG5108> hope, <WG1680> we use <WG5530> great <WG4183> plainness <WG3954> of speech:

And not as Moses, <WG3475> which put <WG5087> a veil <WG2571> over <WG1909> his face, <WG4383> that the children <WG5207> of Israel <WG2474> could not steadfastly <WG816> look <WG816> to the end <WG5056> of that which is abolished: <WG2673>

But their minds <WG3540> were blinded: <WG4456> for until <WG891> this <WG4594> day <WG4594> remains <WG3306> the same <WG846> veil <WG2571> not taken <WG3361> <WG348> away <WG343> in the reading <WG320> of the old <WG3820> testament; <WG1242> which <WG3748> veil is done <WG2673> away <WG2673> in Christ. <WG5547>
But even <WG2193> to this <WG4594> day, <WG4594> when <WG2259> Moses <WG3475> is read, <WG314> the veil <WG2571> is on their heart. <WG2588>
Nevertheless <WG1161> when <WG2259> it shall turn <WG1994> to the Lord, <WG2962> the veil <WG2571> shall be taken <WG4014> away. <WG4014>
Now <WG1161> the Lord <WG2962> is that Spirit: <WG4151> and where <WG3757> the Spirit <WG4151> of the Lord <WG2962> is, there <WG1563> is liberty. <WG1657>

But we all, <WG3956> with open <WG343> face <WG4383> beholding <WG2734> as in a glass <WG2734> the glory <WG1391> of the Lord, <WG2962> are changed <WG3339> into the same <WG846> image <WG1504> from glory <WG1391> to glory, <WG1391> even as by the Spirit <WG4151> of the LORD. <WG2962>
